reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 440/19: ALTERNATIVE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THERAPY OR COUNSELLING
reg_info.reg_name_text: ALTERNATIVE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THERAPY OR COUNSELLING

content.content: 1. The following are prescribed for the purposes of clause 59.2 (3) (b) of the Act as alternative eligibility requirements for receiving funding under the program established in subsection 59.2 (1) of the Act: 1.  A person is eligible for funding if it is alleged in a complaint or report against a member received by the College that the child was the subject of sexual abuse or of a prohibited act involving child pornography and, in the opinion of the College, the child was not, at the time of the alleged sexual abuse or prohibited act involving child pornography, a child the member supervised or was responsible for in the course of the member’s practice, but the member’s practice facilitated the relationship between the child and the member, or the member’s access to the child.
content.raw_html:
1. The following are prescribed for the purposes of clause 59.2 (3) (b) of the Act as alternative eligibility requirements for receiving funding under the program established in subsection 59.2 (1) of the Act:

1.  A person is eligible for funding if it is alleged in a complaint or report against a member received by the College that the child was the subject of sexual abuse or of a prohibited act involving child pornography and, in the opinion of the College, the child was not, at the time of the alleged sexual abuse or prohibited act involving child pornography, a child the member supervised or was responsible for in the course of the member’s practice, but the member’s practice facilitated the relationship between the child and the member, or the member’s access to the child.

content.content: 2. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).
content.raw_html: 2. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).
